result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Allen Chavez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Allen Chavez appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Richard Allen Chavez.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for status. Defense has filed a motion to withdraw. Discussion held. Court grants defense's motion to withdraw. Defendant advised that due to the conflict with the PD's Office, their office will appoint private counsel. Case adjourned for a status of counsel. Case remains calendared in Br 15.
Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court, defendant Richard Allen Chavez not in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means.
CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO COURT REPORTER AVAILABILITY.
Case heard by ZOOM.
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has not received discovery from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 15.  Status conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with Pick-Save- St. Francis; and co-actor Sara Deboer.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Richard Allen Chavez in court with attorney Jane Jerman.  Defendant Richard Allen Chavez in custody.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Case is adjourned to Br. 19 for pretrial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
